1545.verse: قَالَتْ|She said,|81|93|2789$يَـٰوَيْلَتَىٰٓ|"Woe to me!|102|127|4917$ءَأَلِدُ|Shall I bear a child|143|168|8613$وَأَنَا۟|while I am|87|112|1401$عَجُوزٌ|an old woman|111|136|8614$وَهَـٰذَا|and this,|78|90|2989$بَعْلِى|my husband,|104|113|8615$شَيْخًا‌ۖ|(is) an old man?|126|145|8616$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|89|58$هَـٰذَا|this|59|78|248$لَشَىْءٌ|(is) surely a thing|137|156|8617$عَجِيبٌ|amazing."|85|94|8618$

1546.verse: قَالُوٓاْ|They said,|89|107|101$أَتَعْجَبِينَ|"Are you amazed|131|168|8619$مِنْ|at|50|86|53$أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ‌ۖ|(the) decree of Allah?|165|202|8504$رَحْمَتُ ٱللَّهِ|The Mercy of Allah|144|162|8620$وَبَرَكَـٰتُهُۥ|and His blessings|132|157|8621$عَلَيْكُمْ|(be) upon you,|119|168|416$أَهْلَ|people|63|112|5119$ٱلْبَيْتِ‌ۚ|(of) the house.|121|170|3112$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, He|92|117|396$حَمِيدٌ|(is) All-Praiseworthy,|159|366|2422$مَّجِيدٌ|All-Glorious."|103|310|8622$

1547.verse: فَلَمَّا|And when|85|97|141$ذَهَبَ|(had) gone away|133|156|8391$عَنْ|from|54|77|1105$إِبْرَٲهِيمَ|Ibrahim|91|114|1127$ٱلرَّوْعُ|the fright,|87|110|8623$وَجَآءَتْهُ|and had reached him|158|170|8624$ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ|the glad tidings,|127|147|8218$يُجَـٰدِلُنَا|he argued with Us,|145|184|8625$فِى|concerning|92|131|89$قَوْمِ|the people|90|129|6511$لُوطٍ|of Lut.|64|84|8607$

1549.verse: يَـٰٓإِبْرَٲهِيمُ|O Ibrahim!|106|120|8629$أَعْرِضْ|Turn away|95|122|4977$عَنْ|from|54|81|1105$هَـٰذَآ‌ۖ|this.|59|86|248$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, it|84|111|396$قَدْ|certainly|77|104|1097$جَآءَ|has come,|88|102|4023$أَمْرُ|(the) Command|122|131|8630$رَبِّكَ‌ۖ|(of) your Lord|112|130|1322$وَإِنَّهُمْ|and indeed, [they]|144|162|5517$ءَاتِيهِمْ|(will) come (for) them|165|184|8631$عَذَابٌ|a punishment|108|117|72$غَيْرُ|(which) cannot|121|344|4343$مَرْدُودٍ|(be) repelled.|109|332|8632$

1550.verse: وَلَمَّا|And when|85|99|852$جَآءَتْ|came|80|109|5938$رُسُلُنَا|Our messengers|125|154|4931$لُوطًا|(to) Lut,|77|106|8633$سِىٓءَ|he was distressed|139|168|8634$بِهِمْ|for them|76|90|125$وَضَاقَ|and felt straitened|143|160|8635$بِهِمْ|for them|76|110|125$ذَرْعًا|(and) uneasy,|113|147|8636$وَقَالَ|and said,|80|114|1089$هَـٰذَا|"This|59|93|248$يَوْمٌ|(is) a day|84|101|2262$عَصِيبٌ|distressful."|97|97|8637$

1551.verse: وَجَآءَهُۥ|And came (to) him|143|152|8638$قَوْمُهُۥ|his people|86|105|5765$يُهْرَعُونَ|rushing,|102|121|8639$إِلَيْهِ|to him,|66|85|296$وَمِن قَبْلُ|and before|106|125|8640$كَانُواْ|they (had) been|128|137|94$يَعْمَلُونَ|doing|92|102|912$ٱلسَّيِّـَٔـاتِ‌ۚ|the evil deeds.|118|137|3823$قَالَ|He said,|73|92|309$يَـٰقَوْمِ|"O my people!|112|131|513$هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ|These|82|101|335$بَنَاتِى|(are) my daughters,|153|162|8641$هُنَّ|they|51|57|1628$أَطْهَرُ|(are) purer|92|105|8642$لَكُمْ‌ۖ|for you.|72|85|207$فَٱتَّقُواْ|So fear|73|86|230$ٱللَّهَ|Allah|53|66|184$وَلَا|and (do) not|104|117|25$تُخْزُونِ|disgrace me|99|112|8643$فِى|concerning|92|98|89$ضَيْفِىٓ‌ۖ|my guests.|93|117|8644$أَلَيْسَ|Is (there) not|111|160|5522$مِنكُمْ|among you|92|141|643$رَجُلٌ|a man|69|118|3777$رَّشِيدٌ|right-minded?"|115|139|8645$

1554.verse: قَالُواْ|They said,|89|105|101$يَـٰلُوطُ|"O Lut!|75|107|8652$إِنَّا|Indeed, we|94|126|120$رُسُلُ|(are) messengers|135|167|6007$رَبِّكَ|(of) your Lord,|117|149|1322$لَن|never|57|73|524$يَصِلُوٓاْ|they will reach|117|128|8653$إِلَيْكَ‌ۖ|you.|61|84|45$فَأَسْرِ|So travel|80|103|8654$بِأَهْلِكَ|with your family|125|148|8655$بِقِطْعٍ|in a part|76|99|8656$مِّنَ|of|50|73|156$ٱلَّيْلِ|the night|80|91|1418$وَلَا|and (let) not|105|111|25$يَلْتَفِتْ|look back|82|94|8657$مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ|anyone of you,|120|132|8658$إِلَّا|except|65|77|86$ٱمْرَأَتَكَ‌ۖ|your wife.|90|102|8659$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, it|84|96|396$مُصِيبُهَا|will strike her|107|113|8660$مَآ|what|53|68|262$أَصَابَهُمْ‌ۚ|will strike them.|124|155|3349$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|101|58$مَوْعِدَهُمُ|their appointed time|153|184|8661$ٱلصُّبْحُ‌ۚ|(is) morning.|103|134|8662$أَلَيْسَ|Is not|68|83|5522$ٱلصُّبْحُ|the morning|98|345|8662$بِقَرِيبٍ|near?"|83|330|8663$

1545.verse: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"

1546.verse: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."

1547.verse: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.

1548.verse: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

1549.verse: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."

1550.verse: And when Our messengers, [the angels], came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."

1551.verse: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"

1552.verse: They said, "You have already known that we have not concerning your daughters any claim, and indeed, you know what we want."

1553.verse: He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."

1554.verse: The angels said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your Lord; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
